member.name: T:Neon.YugaByte.NamespaceDoc
member.summary: This namespace includes the YugaByte related utilities and extensions.

member.name: T:Neon.Xunit.YugaByte.YugaByteFixture
member.summary: Used to run YugaByte database server and its related and services as a Docker compose application on the current machine as a test fixture while tests are being performed and then deletes the application when the fixture is disposed.

remarks.para: This fixture assumes that YugaByte is not currently running on the local workstation or is running as a application named yugabyte-dev. You may see port conflict errors if either of these conditions are not true.
See for more information about how this works.

member.name: F:Neon.Xunit.YugaByte.YugaByteFixture.DefaultYcqlPort
member.summary: Specifies the Cassandra YCQL port to be exposed by the fixture.

member.name: F:Neon.Xunit.YugaByte.YugaByteFixture.DefaultYsqlPort
member.summary: Specifies the Postgres YSQL port to be exposed by the fixture.

member.name: F:Neon.Xunit.YugaByte.YugaByteFixture.BaseComposeFile
member.summary: The default Docker compose file text used to spin up YugaByte and it's related services by the .

member.name: M:Neon.Xunit.YugaByte.YugaByteFixture.Start(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32)

summary.para: Starts a YugaByte compose application if it's not already running. You'll generally want to call this in your test class constructor instead of .
summary.note: You'll need to call instead when this fixture is being added to a .

member.param: Optionally specifies the Docker compose application name (defaults to yugabyte-dev).
Optionally specifies the Cassandra keyspace. This defaults to test_cassandra. Note that the and must be different.
Optionally specifies the Postgres database. This defaults to test_postgres. Note that the and must be different.
Optionally indicates that the compose application should remain running after the fixture is disposed.

Specifies the port to be exposed by the Cassandra YCQL service. This currently defaults to which is temporarily set to 9099 to avoid conflicts with the Cassandra DBs deployed by the Cadence and Temporal test fixtures but we hope eventually to change those to use a different port so we can revert this to the standard 9042 port.
Specifies the port to be exposed by the Postgres YCQL service. This defaults to which is set to the default Postgres port 5433.
member.returns: if the fixture wasn't previously started and this method call started it or if the fixture was already running.

member.name: M:Neon.Xunit.YugaByte.YugaByteFixture.StartAsComposed(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.Boolean,System.Int32,System.Int32)
member.summary: Used to start the fixture within a .
member.param: Optionally specifies the YugaByte compose application name (defaults to yugabyte-dev).
Optionally specifies the name of the test Cassandra keyspace to be created. This defaults to test_cassandra. Note that the and must be different.
Optionally specifies the name of the test Postgres database to be created. This defaults to test_postgres. Note that the and must be different.
Optionally indicates that the compose application should remain running after the fixture is disposed.

Specifies the port to be exposed by the Cassandra YCQL service. This currently defaults to which is temporarily set to 9099 to avoid conflicts with the Cassandra DBs deployed by the Cadence and Temporal test fixtures but we hope eventually to change those to use a different port so we can revert this to the standard 9042 port.
Specifies the port to be exposed by the Postgres YCQL service. This defaults to which is set to the default Postgres port 5433.

member.name: M:Neon.Xunit.YugaByte.YugaByteFixture.Initialize
member.summary: Initializes the database and establishes the connections.
